ORDER re 8 Motion to Stay as to Eduardo Perez-Figueroa(1), Clarivel Perez-Figueroa (12), Angelina Marrero-Lopez (13). Order: The Court, having original jurisdiction over the case, Orders the stay of release of the defendants herein mentioned. Such Order will remain in effect until defendants are transferred to the District of Puerto Rico and appear at a hearing before this Court. Hearing is to be set immediately upon defendants' initial appearance in the District of Puerto Rico. Signed by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado- Colon on 4/4/2012. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment as to Noslen M. Nieves-Marrero (22) Count 10,11 held on 4/9/2012. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza and Mr. Jose Irizarry. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to both counts. The parties are granted seven (7) days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motion. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for scheduling. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Interpreter -Felix Toledo. (yr) (Entered: 04/19/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Melvin X. Mena-Santana (19) Count 1,2 held on 4/9/2012. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza and Mr. Carlos Vazquez-Alvarez. Mr. Luis Rivera-Rodriguez was also present, but informed that he was filing a motion to withdraw as attorney. The Court ruled that Mr. Vazquez would represent this defendant as previously appointed under the CJA Panel. Defendant was found competent at this  time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to both counts. The parties are granted seven (7) days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motion. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for scheduling. As to bail, Mr. Vazquez informed that at this time they had nothing to offer. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:48.Hearing ended at 09:52.Interpreter -Felix Toledo. (yr) (Entered: 04/19/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Tomas Hector Vidal-Cotto (15) Count 1,2 held on 4/9/2012. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza and Ms. Laura Maldonado. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to both counts. The parties are granted seven (7) days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motion. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for scheduling.As to bail, the parties informed that they had reached a stipulation as to bail, which the Court approved and set bail in the amount of $80,000.00 cash or secured by property, employment, home detention with EM, plus standard conditions of release. Defendant was granted until April 13, 2012 to post. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Interpreter -Felix Toledo. (yr) (Entered: 04/19/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Gary E. Maysonet-Miranda (18) Count 1,2 held on 4/9/2012. Present were AUSA Mariana Bauza and Mr. Jose R. Gaztambide. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to both counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for scheduling. As to bail, arguments heard. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention as to Clarivel Perez-Figueroa (12) held on 5/16/2012. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense counsel Luis Rivera. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Carmen Perez also present. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1, 2, and 9. The defendant is granted 7 days to obtain discovery and 14 days thereafter for the filing of motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel argues that conditions of release be fixed. Government's proffer heard and requests detention. After hearing the parties, the Court sets bails as follows: Bond set as to Clarivel Perez- Figueroa (12) $150,000($75,000 secured with cash or real estate property and remaining amount unsecured). Home Detention with an electronic monitoring device is imposed. Mental and psychiatric treatment is ordered. Defendant to be released once secured amount is posted and USPO has identified that a land line has been installed. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 9:00 a.m. Hearing held at 9:36 a.m. Hearing ended at 9:42 a.m. Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (sr) (Entered: 05/16/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention as to Angelina Marrero-Lopez (13) held on 5/16/2012. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense counsel Esther Castro-Schmidt. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Carmen Perez also present. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to count(s) 1, 2 and 9. The defendant is granted 7 days to obtain  discovery and 14 days thereafter for the filing of motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel argues that conditions of release can be fixed. Government's proffer heard and requests detention. The Court sets bail as follows: $150,000 secured with cash or real estate property, no bonding company will be accepted and the properties that appear mentioned within the indictment cannot be considered. Home detention and an electronic monitoring device is also imposed. Other standard conditions of release apply. Defendant to be released once secured amount is posted and a land line has been installed. Defense counsel anticipates filing a motion to lower the secured amount. The Court takes note and defense is to file motion accordingly, if deemed so necessary, and the Court will entertain the same. (Court Reporter FTR.) Hearing set for 9:00 a.m. Hearing held at 9:22 a.m. Hearing ended at 9:35 a.m. Interpreter Marie Hernandez. (sr) (Entered: 05/16/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: DeNovo Hearing as to Benjamin Perez-Figueroa held on 5/17/2012. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense counsel Ramon Garcia. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Emmanuel Bravo also present. Parties proceed by proffer. Government plays three audio recordings of phone calls involving the defendant. The defense then presents the testimony of Julio Vazquez-Lopez. Cross-examination. Matter is submitted. Based on the nature of the offense, the defendant's role within the conspiracy, and the weight of the Government's evidence, the Court finds that the defendant poses a danger to the community and he is ordered to remain under custody. It's noted that the defense only addressed the presumption of flight risk. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:25 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:10 a.m. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (sr) (Entered: 05/17/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Sinara Ramos-Rivera was held on 6/26/2012. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza, Atty Ricardo Izurieta, Intepreter Felix Toledo and Defendant. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties she is facing, her constitutional rights, consequences of waiving her constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Aida M. Delgado Colon, U.S. District Chief Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon. Defendant to remain detained pending sentencing. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter FTR.) (Hearing was set for 1:30 p.m., held at 2:36-3:07 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 06/27/2012)

Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza, Atty Miguel Canals, Interpreter Thomas Kavelin and Defendant. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado Colon. Defendant to remain detained pending sentencing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Show Cause Hearing as to Eduardo Perez-Figueroa held on 10/31/2012. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense attorneys Francisco Acevedo, Rafael Castro-Lang and Lara Helena Castro. Defendant assisted by the Court Interpreter. Court notes that attorneys Rafael Castro-Lang and Lara Castro are not present. The Courtroom Deputy is to reach them and they are to appear in court. All defense attorneys are present. Court notes that at the Further S/C held on 10/25/2012 attorney Lara Castro informed that defendant was unaware of the charge pending against him and discovery had not been discussed. Upon inquiry of the Court, Government informs that three discovery packages have been provided and that the first discovery package was picked up by attorney Lara Castro on 5/15/2012, period in which attorney Castro-Lang had been court appointed by the Magistrate Judge. The other discovery packages were picked up by attorney Acevedo. Attorney Francisco Acevedo informs the times he has seen defendant at MDC- Guaynabo and that he had spoken to defendant before the charges had been filed. Possible conflict with his representation was later discussed in one of their meetings along with plea offer extended by the Government which was rejected by defendant. Court notes that it reviewed copy of the attorneys log book from MDC-Guaynabo. Statements are then heard by attorneys Rafael Castro and Lara Castro. The Court notes that the underlying facts of the case were indeed explained to defendant by attorney Acevedo and that attorney Lara Castro was induced to error by defendant. Therefore, there are no facts or evidence that defendant had been neglected and defendant has had ample assistance by counsel. Ex-parte matter discussed at bench with attorney Francisco Acevedo. All parties excused upon conclusion of the Ex-Parte Conference. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 11:30 a.m. Hearing held at 1:10 p.m. Hearing ended at 1:30 p.m. Interpreter Edna Brayfield/Janis Palma. (sr) (Entered: 11/02/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Daniel Cosme-Rios held on 4/4/2013. AUSA Julia Meconiates and defense counsel Michael Corona were present. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts. The defendant is to remain under custody. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. Sentence will be set at a later date. A report and recommendation will be issued. s/c: PO through e-mail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 10:42. Hearing ended at 11:03. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (br) (Entered: 04/04/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Motion Hearing as to Francisco E. Lopez-Negron held on 3/4/2014 re 936 MOTION Requesting Permission to file voucher filed by Francisco E. Lopez-Negron. Present: AUSA Nicholas Cannon and defense counsel Jennie Espada. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Previous CJA counsel Ruben Cerezo also present. Upon inquiry of the Court, attorney Cerezo explained how Attorney Espada became counsel of his former  client. The defendant, being assisted by attorney Espada, was also inquired on the matter and defendant's sister Ms. Maria Lopez who was in court was inquired as well. Attorney Espada informed she had been retained by defendant's sister to represent him in this case and in CR 10-0251-15 (JAF) for post conviction remedies. Court notes that there was no indication on the record that defendant was not satisfied with his previous CJA counsel and that the CJA-23 Financial Affidavit completed by defendant showed he had no resources to retain counsel and that as informed by counsel, defendant entered a plea of guilty to the same plea offer already negotiated by attorney Cerezo. Court will look further into the matter due to its legal source of concern pursuant to Section 230.40. Court will encourage other judicial officers to do so as well and consider if when such a situation as this arises that defendant might be ordered to reimburse monies spent under CJA funds when relatives retain counsel on defendant's behalf. Attorney Cerezo's motion to file CJA Voucher is Granted. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 3:20 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:00 p.m. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (sr) (Entered: 03/10/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: First Status Conference as to Enrique Rodriguez (3) held on 1/13/2015. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense counsel Jorge Vega-Pacheco. Defense counsel acknowledges discovery has been provided, however, it's voluminous. Requests 45 days to review the same with his client and continue meeting with Government's counsel. Also requests the Court make findings tolling the STA in the best interest of justice. Government has no objection to the request, clarifies, that a plea offer was also extended to the defense. Given the extensive discovery provided in the case, that counsel is in need to review it with his client, the request is Granted and the STA is tolled in the best interest of justice. Further Status Conference set for 3/23/2015 at 5:00 PM in Courtroom | before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. Time of hearing may be advanced, if the Court's trial setting is vacated. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Further Status Conference as to Enrique Rodriguez (3), Anthony Garcia-Torres (6) held on 3/23/2015. Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense attorneys Jorge Vega-Pacheco and Luis Rivera-Rodriguez. Attorney Vega informs that defendant is still reviewing discovery, plea negotiations are ongoing and does not expect defendant will go to trial. Requests 30 days to conclude negotiations and review of discovery. Attorney Rivera informs he made a plea counter-offer. Government states the offer 1s reyected. Based on Government's statement, counsel will meet again with client and with Government to continue with plea negotiations. After hearing the parties, a final 30 day extension is granted. A Joint Change of Plea Hearing is set for 4/22/2015 at 4:00 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. Final Status Conference set for 4/22/2015 at 4:00 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado- Colon. Jury Trial set for May 11-26, 2015 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. If plea is not reached, the Government informs that it will take 2 weeks to present their case in chief. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:  Sentencing held on 9/2/2015 for Anthony Garcia-Torres (6). Present: AUSA Mariana Bauza and defense counsel Luis Rivera. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial Appearance as to Erik Omar Ortiz-Melendez (5) held on 5/12/2017. Defendant was provided with copy of the Indictment and advised as to his rights. Also, defendant was advised of the applicable minimum and maximum statutory penalties that he is exposed  to if convicted of the charges in the indictment. Defendant informed the Court that he has retained the services of counsel Julio Gil De Lamadrid to represent him in this case. JUDGMENT of USCA as to Jose M. Marrero-Santana (9) re 1078 Notice of Appeal - Final Judgment; Defendant-Appellant Jose M. Marrero-Santana appeals his sentence on drug, 21 U.S.C. §§ 841(a)(1) & 846, and firearm, 18 U.S.C. § 924(c), convictions. We remand for resentencing limited to the issue of supervised release on the § 924(c) conviction. We leave it to the district court to determine whether a corrected PSR should be ordered, and we express no opinion as to the appropriate supervised release term for the § 924(c) conviction, except of course to say that any term imposed should be based on correct guidelines calculations and should comport with statute. In accordance with the foregoing, we VACATE and REMAND for further proceedings consistent with this judgment. (xi) (Entered: 05/08/2019)
